channel.title: Home of Ish
channel.description: Recent content on Home of Ish

item.title: Dada
item.description: Dada (Hindi for Grandad) Disciplined, a minimalist, extremely supportive, ever loving, the most reliable person ever, flexible and yet a maverick, a stubborn resilient fighter…all of these terms can only help in painting a snippet of what my grandad, dada, meant to me. However, the term I would choose over all these is companion. In fact, I would even argue that he was my companion more than anyone else’s towards the last few years of his life.

item.title: My Open Water Course
item.description: This is something that I have yearned for the longest. I have always wanted to dive properly, get certified, and obtain that freedom to dive wherever I go. A certified Open Water Diver is what I am now. It feels good, amazing, blissful, grateful, extremely lucky, and free. Free from the age long constraints that I have had put on me. I finally feel that I am free. I finally felt that I was free.

item.title: A Bangalore Farewell
item.description: I had my official in-office farewell today at Locus. It was a quaint gathering organized by our CHO (let’s see if you can find out what this term means). We had a couple of cakes that I couldn’t eat (thanks to Bangalore weather caused phlegm), a couple of people that cared about me and a couple people amiss. I gave an underwhelming farewell speech, with a smile on my face grinning eye to eye.

item.title: Musings@Loneliness
item.description: Recently, I have been feeling a little lonely. A little alone in this beautiful city called Bangalore. Down with viral, there’s not much that I can do apart from limited eating outside, limited physical activity, and limited social energy. On any normal day, badminton would be my go-to activity. I would end up exercising, learning a new skill, socializing, and clearing my thoughts. All of these are extremely important needs that I need to give time to whenever and wherever to function productively.

item.title: About Me
